trans-unit.source: Connection Libraries for SQL Database and SQL Server
trans-unit.target: Connection Libraries for SQL Database and SQL Server

trans-unit.source: Lists the minimum version number for each driver that client programs can use to connect to Azure SQL Database or to Microsoft SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: Lists the minimum version number for each driver that client programs can use to connect to Azure SQL Database or to Microsoft SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: A link is provided for version information about drivers that are released by the community rather than by Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: A link is provided for version information about drivers that are released by the community rather than by Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Connection Libraries for SQL Database and SQL Server
trans-unit.target: Connection Libraries for SQL Database and SQL Server

trans-unit.source: This topic lists the minimum version number for each library/driver that client programs can use when connecting to Azure SQL Database or to Microsoft SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: This topic lists the minimum version number for each library/driver that client programs can use when connecting to Azure SQL Database or to Microsoft SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: This topic is split into two sections:
trans-unit.target: This topic is split into two sections:

trans-unit.source: *Table of driver libraries released by Microsoft* - covers libraries that Microsoft has released.
trans-unit.target: *Table of driver libraries released by Microsoft* - covers libraries that Microsoft has released.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft maintains the information that is in this section.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft maintains the information that is in this section.

trans-unit.source: *Third party libraries* - lists libraries that are released and maintained by third parties rather than by Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: *Third party libraries* - lists libraries that are released and maintained by third parties rather than by Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Only the public community of developers maintains this section.
trans-unit.target: Only the public community of developers maintains this section.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft will not maintain this section.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft will not maintain this section.

trans-unit.source: Table of driver libraries released by Microsoft
trans-unit.target: Table of driver libraries released by Microsoft

trans-unit.source: The following table displays libraries that are released by Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: The following table displays libraries that are released by Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: The **Libraries** column provides links you can use to download each library.
trans-unit.target: The **Libraries** column provides links you can use to download each library.

trans-unit.source: The **Version** column lists the minimum version that is recommended for interacting with Azure SQL Database and Microsoft SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: The **Version** column lists the minimum version that is recommended for interacting with Azure SQL Database and Microsoft SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Type 4 JDBC driver that provides database connectivity through the standard JDBC API
trans-unit.target: Type 4 JDBC driver that provides database connectivity through the standard JDBC API

trans-unit.source: Microsoft ODBC Driver for SQL Server
trans-unit.target: Microsoft ODBC Driver for SQL Server

trans-unit.target: Microsoft ODBC Driver for SQL Server

trans-unit.source: Microsoft ODBC Driver for SQL Server
trans-unit.target: Microsoft ODBC Driver for SQL Server

trans-unit.source: OLEDB for DB2 and SQL Server, for DRDA design
trans-unit.target: OLEDB for DB2 and SQL Server, for DRDA design

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft OLE DB Provider for DB2 Version 5.0 (Data Provider) lets you create distributed applications targeting IBM DB2 databases.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft OLE DB Provider for DB2 Version 5.0 (Data Provider) lets you create distributed applications targeting IBM DB2 databases.

trans-unit.source: The Data Provider takes advantage of Microsoft SQL Server data access architecture together with a Microsoft network client for DB2 that functions as a Distributed Relational Database Architecture (DRDA) application requester.
trans-unit.target: The Data Provider takes advantage of Microsoft SQL Server data access architecture together with a Microsoft network client for DB2 that functions as a Distributed Relational Database Architecture (DRDA) application requester.

trans-unit.source: The Data Provider converts Microsoft Component Object Model (COM) OLE DB commands and data types to DRDA protocol code points and data formats.
trans-unit.target: The Data Provider converts Microsoft Component Object Model (COM) OLE DB commands and data types to DRDA protocol code points and data formats.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft OLE DB Provider for DB2 Version 5.0
trans-unit.target: Microsoft OLE DB Provider for DB2 Version 5.0

trans-unit.source: Microsoft OLEDB Provider for DB2 v4.0 for Microsoft SQL Server 2012
trans-unit.target: Microsoft OLEDB Provider for DB2 v4.0 for Microsoft SQL Server 2012

trans-unit.source: It is up to the public community of developers to update and maintain the information that is in this "Third party libraries" section, by using the [azure-content](http://github.com/Azure/azure-content/) repository owned by **Azure** on GitHub.com.
trans-unit.target: It is up to the public community of developers to update and maintain the information that is in this "Third party libraries" section, by using the [azure-content](http://github.com/Azure/azure-content/) repository owned by **Azure** on GitHub.com.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft encourages developers to update this section.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft encourages developers to update this section.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft personnel do *not* intend to maintain the information that is in this section, partly because other people are more expert with each particular third party library than we are.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft personnel do *not* intend to maintain the information that is in this section, partly because other people are more expert with each particular third party library than we are.
